clinical_study.brief_title: Functional Residual Capacity Measured by Capnography in Ventilated Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Positive End-expiratory Pressure on Functional Residual Capacity Measured by Volumetric Capnography in Mechanically Ventilated Patients

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Privado de Comunidad de Mar del Plata

clinical_study.source: Hospital Privado de Comunidad de Mar del Plata

brief_summary.textblock: Changes in body position during anesthesia can alter functional residual capacity and gas exchange. The monitoring of such changes in functional residual capacity is difficult at the bedside. The present study was designed to determine if volumetric capnography can detect changes in the functional residual capacity during surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a prospective and observational study designed to test the reliability of the capnodynamic equation to determine changes in functional residual capacity measured during anesthesia. The investigators will studied 40 mechanically ventilated patients undergoing general anesthesia. Functional residual capacity will be continuously measured in a non invasive way using expired carbon dioxide. Changes in functional residual capacity with standard modification in body positioning (Trendelenburg or anti-Trendelenburg position) and ventilatory settings wiil be tested.

primary_outcome.measure: Functional Residual Capacity Measured by Capnography in Ventilated Patients
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of functional residual capacity with capnography with body positioning changes.

arm_group.description: Patients ASA 1-3, undergoing different types of general anesthesia that need postural changes like Trendelenburg and anti-Trendelenburg positioning.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing general anesthesia for laparoscopic surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written Inform Consent
- Programmed surgery
- Laparoscopic surgery
- Supine position
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergency surgery
- Chronic respiratory disease
- Active smoking
